What does your team consider good testing?

Level-0 Pre-Basic: Testing against requirements is done but no quality gates are defined for Defects Leaks
Level-1 Basic: Testing is done before any production update
Level-2 Emerging: Testing that promotes continuous improvement in user satisfaction, quality of service, and performance on business objectives
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Testing that is fast enough and thorough enough to provide feedback in the continuous integration and continuous delivery flow
Level-4 Enhanced: Testing that covers most used functionality, data, code paths and configurations, with coverage measured against them
Level-5 Top Level: Testing that validates conformance to requirements and fixes of identified bugs

When do you test for security?

Level-0 Pre-Basic: When there is a vulnerability in place. Rather reactive fixes or not at all.
Level-1 Basic: Security Testing is done based on the monthly reports from GIT
Level-2 Emerging: Before a major release
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Before any production release
Level-4 Enhanced: As part of the pull request and code review flow before code is committed
Level-5 Top Level: Security tests are run In the continuous integration and continuous delivery pipeline

Are you having organized planning meeting for roadmap & requirement planning?
Level-0 Pre-Basic: Requirement planning is not captured anywhere
Level-1 Basic: Requirement planning in place but different teams work in Silos for their planning
Level-2 Emerging: different tools are in place for requirement planning. Different teams collaborate but not able to lay future plan with current structure in place
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Requirement planning is captured in single tool like excel & word but managing for different teams for laying future planning based on that is difficult task
Level-4 Enhanced: Requirement planning is captured in unified tool, teams are collaborating but their frequency is random hence creating difficulty in laying roadmap for the future
Level-5 Top Level: Requirement Planning captured in unified tool with progress being tracked. Different teams collaborate during Iteration planning & PI planning and lays future roadmap

Requirements are tracked to production release?
Level-0 Pre-Basic: Requirements are just recorded but no traceability exists
Level-1 Basic: Requirements are captured in different tools hence difficult to trace changes till production release
Level-2 Emerging: Requirements are captured in different tools and production tracking is with different tool
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Requirements are getting tracked in one tool but no technical mapping of requirements with deployment pipeline available

Level-4 Enhanced: Requirements are captured in unified tool but traceability is limited only till Test case execution available while deploying to production is not connected with requirement tracking

Level-5 Top Level: Requirements are captured in unified tool which helps in capturing requirement IDs while executing deployment through pipelines, capturing test case execution & results, hence ensuring end to end traceability.

How does your project team design solutions?
Phase:Design, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: Architecture Design is worked upon in silo. UI UX no design is presented to Business wrt requirements. Each project in separation with no sharing / re-use of common building blocks
Level-1 Basic: Some projects sharing and re-using common building blocks. UI UX design is presented to Business wrt requirements

Level-2 Emerging: Many projects sharing and re-using common building blocks with some projects developing new building blocks to be used by other projects at a later stage. UI UX Prototype is shared to Business at the Design Stage itself
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Most projects are sharing and re-using common building blocks with most projects + developing new building blocks to be used by other projects at a later stage

Level-4 Enhanced: All projects and programs are actively sharing and re-using common building blocks with all projects developing new building blocks to be used by other projects and programs at a later stage
Level-5 Top Level: All designs are accessible to application team and to Business

How automated is the application with respect to Requirement Gathering & Design, SCM, Build & Deploy, Quality & Unit Testing, Provisioning & Virtualization, Configuration Management & Integration and Monitoring
How does your team (or your organisation, if you deal with multiple teams) include architecture in your products and way of working?
Phase:Design, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: There is no architecture known, no principles set or rules defined

Level-1 Basic: Architecture mostly comprises a set of rules to be used across all teams, which are defined in architectural documentation. There is no active assurance of these architectural rules in the teams

Level-2 Emerging: Architectural principles have been set, but are not updated or evolving frequently. Teams mostly apply the principles, but there is no direct feedback mechanism between the architects and the teams

Level-3 Co-ordinated: An intentional architecture is set, which is fully aimed at enabling principle-based sharing of tools, technology and practices. The emerging architecture is added to this architectural runway manually. There is alignment between the dev and ops architecture, yet there may be some differences

Level-4 Enhanced: An intentional architecture is set, which is fully aimed at enabling principle-based sharing of tools, technology and practices.  There is no difference between dev & ops architectures.

Level-5 Top Level: An intentional architecture is set, which is fully aimed at enabling principle-based sharing of tools, technology and practices. The emerging architecture is added to this architectural runway in a mostly automated fashion. There is no difference between dev ; ops architectures.

Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q23_automation23_desired_level}

How automated is the application with respect to Requirement Gathering & Design, SCM, Build & Deploy, Quality & Unit Testing, Provisioning & Virtualization, Configuration Management & Integration and Monitoring
Phase:Virtualization, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: No focus on Virtualization
Level-1 Basic: The focus is on the Individual where there are one-off attempts to bridge gaps obstructing an individuals ability to complete a specific development or test task
Level-2 Emerging: The focus is on the project where Service Virtualization is used emulate dependent system components and allows the projects development or testing tasks to shift left.

Level-3 Co-ordinated: The focus is on the test environment where service virtualization provides consistent access to development and test environments that involve difficult-to-access, inconsistent, or unreliable system dependencies

Level-4 Enhanced: The focus is on creating test scenarios where multiple test environments (e.g., for performance, security, error conditions,) are coordinated to rapidly exercise different scenarios at each SDLC stageachieving more automation and better test outcomes
Level-5 Top Level: One click deployments to spin up application, environments , data and configurations

How automated is the application with respect to Requirement Gathering & Design, SCM, Build & Deploy, Quality & Unit Testing, Provisioning & Virtualization, Configuration Management & Integration and Monitoring
Phase:Configuration Management, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: No Configuration management process setup wrt Application and Infrastructure

Level-1 Basic: System configurations in place for Managed systems which can include servers, storage, networking, and software  with description of the desired state of systems documented and maintained well
Level-2 Emerging: Consistent management of  softwares and systems using some automation with an automation software
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Consistent management of softwares and systems using full automation with an automation software with focus on Infrastructure as a Code
Level-4 Enhanced: Configurations as a code which  enables the ability to scale infrastructure and software systems without having to correspondingly scale administrative staff to manage those systems
Level-5 Top Level: Maintain and manage Configurations drift  automatically or via self learning algorithms

How is the team's culture of collaboration? How does the team traces the application lifecycle and workflow?
Teams involved (Dev, Testing, Support, Operations) are multidisciplinary and works in a collaborative environment to deliver end-to-end values
Level-0 Pre-Basic: No collboration amongst different teams
Level-1 Basic: No collaboration between teams and managed as individual driven
Level-2 Emerging: Teams are separate and collaborate only on need basis
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Managed more as individual driven but collaborate only for certain tasks
Level-4 Enhanced: Team collaborate after timelines are defined and work allocation is planned
Level-5 Top Level: All team involved in Project/CR collaborate at the initial stage and define clear set of activities with tentative timelines and dependencies

How is the team's culture of collaboration? How does the team traces the application lifecycle and workflow?
To what extent does your product or service delivery methodology support continuous delivery?

Level-0 Pre-Basic: No clear standards and delivery processes used. Going live is always a serious struggle, adhoc driven, with many incidents occurring after go-live and dissatisfying handover processes and results.
Level-1 Basic: Release management is  leading to long test and wait times (approvals).  Large batches are used (releases)
Level-2 Emerging: Release management  approval time is minimal and minimal batches for release
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Agile methodologies are being used, but these involve the operations and support of the value chain. Going live is done after the actual (development) Iteration.
Level-4 Enhanced: Iterations are being used as release containers, so within each Iteration the product increments will be brought live. Usually at the end of the Iteration, after the demo
Level-5 Top Level: A one piece continuous flow is in place, so every work item (story) is picked up by the team, and is put on production instantly and demo provided to relevant stakeholders.
You selected 'Not Applicable', Please explain in few words why?
Please explain in few words why?:  {q29_lean01}
Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q29_lean01_desired_level}
How well are the teams' culture and behaviour oriented towards the lean principles?
To what extent is your team (or organization if you are involved with multiple teams) focused on reducing the waste?
Phase:System Thinking, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: There is no focus on reducing waste
Level-1 Basic: Only specialists are focusing on reducing waste
Level-2 Emerging: All team members are aware about the waste but taking an initiative to reduce it is lagging
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Team members know how to recognize and eliminate waste, but it is not structurally performed
Level-4 Enhanced: On a periodic (but not very frequent, maybe Monthly) basis, team members actively search for waste reduction opportunities and are mandated to take these away

Level-5 Top Level: Reducing waste is second nature of everyone involved in and around the teams, frequent value stream mapping sessions are being performed. There are some automated processes to identify and handle waste
You selected 'Not Applicable', Please explain in few words why?
Please explain in few words why?:  {q30_lean02}
Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q30_lean02_desired_level}
How well are the teams' culture and behaviour oriented towards the lean principles?
To what extent are the value streams identified within your team or delivery chain?
Level-0 Pre-Basic: There are no value streams known
Level-1 Basic: One or more value streams are known and described in documents, but have no relation to the actual work & decision making (priorities)
Level-2 Emerging: Certain value streams are identified and defined but unable to measure
Level-3 Co-ordinated: The value streams are visible and known to everyone involved, but are not actively being used in decision making (priorities). Measurement is done .

Level-4 Enhanced: The value streams are visible and evolve continuously, the teams are aware of their contribution to these value streams. Decision making on value stream level is not always directly aligned with team level decisions

Level-5 Top Level: The value streams are visible and evolve continuously, the teams are very aware of their contribution to these value streams, and decisions on team levels are aligned real-time with overall value stream decisions and priorities
You selected 'Not Applicable', Please explain in few words why?
Please explain in few words why?:  {q31_lean03}
Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q31_lean03_desired_level}
How well are the teams' culture and behaviour oriented towards the lean principles?
How does your team or your delivery chain deal with bottlenecks (constraints)?
Phase:System Thinking, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: Bottlenecks are not identified
Level-1 Basic: Bottlenecks are identified, but resolving them takes too much time, causing a negative impact
Level-2 Emerging: Bottlenecks are identified but since there is no visualization in place, identifying & deriving itself takes too much of a time
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Because we visualize most of our work, bottlenecks are identified in some cases and eliminated, mostly driven by the Scrum Master. This process is not shared between dev and ops

Level-4 Enhanced: Because we visualize all of our work, bottlenecks become visible instantly and are identified and eliminated effectively by the Scrum Master. Focus is mostly on dev or ops, not a joint effort

Level-5 Top Level: Because we visualize all of our work, bottlenecks become visible instantly and are identified and eliminated effectively by the team as a whole, including dev, ops and all other stakeholders
You selected 'Not Applicable', Please explain in few words why?
Please explain in few words why?:  {q32_lean04}
Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q32_lean04_desired_level}
How well are the teams' culture and behaviour oriented towards the lean principles?
Who are responsible for improvements within the organization?
Level-0 Pre-Basic: No one is responsible for improvements
Level-1 Basic: Line or process managers are responsible for improvements
Level-2 Emerging: Team members are responsible for improvements, managers are responsible for decisions
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Team members are responsible for improvements, and to some extent responsible for decisions
Level-4 Enhanced: Team members are responsible for improvements and make decisions within their scope, managers are coaching/facilitating
Level-5 Top Level: Continual improvements are part of the day-to-day operation, decisions are made by those who know best.
You selected 'Not Applicable', Please explain in few words why?
Please explain in few words why?:  {q33_lean05}
Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q33_lean05_desired_level}
How well are the teams' culture and behaviour oriented towards the lean principles?
To what extent does your team use direct feedback loops?
Level-0 Pre-Basic: No daily stand-ups, no knowledge is collected of release results, no demos are provided.
Level-1 Basic: Feedback loops do not cross functional roles. Developers do not deliver feedback to operations or vice versa.

Level-2 Emerging: Feedback loops do not cross functional roles. Developers do not deliver feedback to operations or vice versa. Some procedures are in place to force feedback, but they are not part of daily practice or behaviour

Level-3 Co-ordinated: Most teams are using daily stand-ups. In some teams, operators join the development team stand-ups, and occasionally join their demos. Business owners and key users are infrequently informed by the PO.

Level-4 Enhanced: Daily stand-ups are used on all levels, including management and other stakeholders. The business is not very much aligned yet, they have other feedback mechanisms, because they do not have much time available for IT stuff

Level-5 Top Level: People continuously provide feedback, systems provide automated feedback as well. Feedback crosses all team and organizational barriers, including the business, suppliers, and supporting roles.

Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q34_lean06_desired_level}
How well are the teams' culture and behaviour oriented towards the lean principles?
Team members have clear roles, plans and goals
Level-0 Pre-Basic: Not required to be apply during execution of project/CR
Level-1 Basic: No transperancy from higher management to lower. Individuals are not clear with their roles and plans
Level-2 Emerging: team members not required to be clear on these parameters they could work at task level
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Goals are defined only during annual event and roles specific to projects are not there. Roles are defined but not sure about plans for executing CR/Project
Level-4 Enhanced: team members are aware about their goals but their roles and plans are not clearly defined in a project/CR
Level-5 Top Level: All team members are aware clearly about their roles & responsibilities, action plans and targetted goals

Level-4 Enhanced: discussion happen between team and consultation with management then follows

Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q44_recovery01_desired_level}
How well the teams are oriented towards the rollback and recovery from failures?
How does your organisation deal with shared infrastructure and its relation to the teams activities?
Level-0 Pre-Basic: There is no clear responsibility who does what regarding infrastructure
Level-1 Basic: All infrastructure is managed centrally, and most of it is on-premises, the teams have no say in this nor knowledge about the details
Level-2 Emerging: All infrastructure is managed centrally, and most of it is on-premises, the teams have a  say in this and have knowledge about the details

Level-3 Co-ordinated: There is an internal infrastructure team, responsible for the generic infrastructure, which is partly cloud-based. They enable and support the teams in their infrastructure demand.

Level-4 Enhanced: There is an internal infrastructure team, responsible for the generic infrastructure, which is partly cloud-based. They facilitate, support and train the teams to optimize them for self-service.
Level-5 Top Level: The generic infrastructure is serviced completely in the cloud and can be adapted on demand by the teams. All teams are using self-service for all their infrastructural needs.

How well the teams are oriented towards the rollback and recovery from failures?
Phase:Enable low risk releases, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: Escalations are considered not important
Level-1 Basic: Action is taken on escalations
Level-2 Emerging: Action is taken only when someone intervenes
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Designated people swarms to fix any issue until its resolved
Level-4 Enhanced: With a stop-the-line mentality, everyone swarms to fix any problem until its resolved
Level-5 Top Level: Findings are then turned into improvements which are integrated into the process or product to prevent repeat problems in the future

Phase:Enable low risk releases, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-1 Basic: One time rehearsal done and not repeated/ Yearly releases
Level-2 Emerging: Rehearsals done on server upgrades only
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Rehearsals done only during major changes
Level-4 Enhanced: Rehearsals planned on a definite  frequency
You selected 'Not Applicable', Please explain in few words why?
Please explain in few words why?:  {q47_recovery04}
Please add brief comment about the rationale for selecting DESIRED LEVEL {q47_recovery04_desired_level}
How well the teams are oriented towards the rollback and recovery from failures?
Build the environment and capability to fix forward or roll back for data
Phase:Enable low risk releases, Business Value:Decrease in Change Failure Rate
Level-0 Pre-Basic: No process defined. Taken as an adhoc / ambiguous activity when need arises
Level-2 Emerging: Automated rollback with manual revert of user transactions
Level-3 Co-ordinated: Automated rollback with automated revert of user transactions with little impact on application
Level-4 Enhanced: Automated rollback with automated revert of user transactions with no impact on application

Level-5 Top Level: Since mistakes will be made, and servers will fail, teams need to develop the capability to quickly fix forward and, where necessary, roll back to a prior known good state. In the latter case, planning and investment must be made to revert any data changes back to the prior state, and not lose any user transactions that occurred during the process.
